title: Ostendio Names Rohit Johri As Chief Technology Officer
text:
Mobile Health IT Industry Veteran to Lead Company’s Technology Evolution
ARLINGTON, VA
Ostendio , a leading provider of healthcare information security and risk management solutions, today announced mobile health IT industry veteran, Rohit Johri, joined the company as its Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Mr. Johri will be responsible for the strategic direction and execution of Ostendio’s continued technology evolution.
In his new role, Mr. Johri will help drive the company’s position in the growing $6.5 billion digital health marketplace with its flagship solution, My Virtual Compliance Manager (MyVCM), a cloud-based security and compliance management platform. Mr. Johri will report directly to Ostendio’s founder and Chief Executive Officer (CEO), Grant Elliott.
“Rohit has been at the forefront of leading edge developments in mobile healthcare and brings a wealth of technology skills to Ostendio”, said Grant Elliott, founder and CEO, Ostendio. “His addition to the Ostendio leadership team allows us to take our technology platform to new levels as we expand in mobile services, predictive analytics, and build security solutions for other regulated markets.”
Mr. Johri brings almost 20 years of experience in health IT, cloud services and software development to Ostendio. He joins Ostendio from Voxiva, Inc., a leader in mobile solutions for digital health, where he led software engineering. During his tenure at Voxiva, Mr. Johri pioneered the groundbreaking “Text4baby”, the nation’s only free mobile information service designed to promote maternal and child health through text messaging. Prior to relocating to the United States, Mr. Johri held technology leadership positions in India, most notably as chief manager at Times Internet Limited (TIL). TIL is the largest online network in India and the digital venture of Times of India. As a member of the leadership team, he was responsible for establishing and building the media platform, which is now considered amongst the fastest growing web-based networks worldwide. He also served as a technology lead with Interra Information Technologies, a global technology solutions and services company.
“Ostendio’s commitment to customer excellence and the rapidly growing marketplace makes this a rare opportunity,” said Rohit Johri, Chief Technology Officer, Ostendio. “In the short time since MyVCM was launched in 2014, there has been very strong customer adoption. I am excited to join such a great team and drive our technology forward as both the market and our customers’ needs evolve.”
About Ostendio
Ostendio is an information security and risk management solutions provider, offering affordable solutions that demonstrate compliance for the healthcare industry.
Ostendio’s My Virtual Compliance Manager (MyVCMTM) is a cloud based compliance management platform that delivers an easy to use, cost-effective way for companies to demonstrate information security compliance to industry standards and regulatory requirements.
The MyVCM Trust Network allows Heath Systems and Digital Health companies to securely share compliance information reducing the compliance burden while improving security and reducing risk. Visit us at http://www.ostendio.com
